subject: Creativity
title: The Mozart Effect: Myth, Reality, and Marketing
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Mozart Effect: Myth, Reality, and Marketing.

hook.text: In 1993, a study claimed listening to Mozart made you smarter.

buildup.text: The original study showed a temporary 8-9 point boost in spatial reasoning after listening to Mozart â€” lasting about 15.

discovery.text: Subsequent research showed ANY stimulating activity â€” upbeat music, conversation, even caffeine â€” produced the same.

twist.text: The 'Mozart Effect' spawned a $2 billion baby music industry. The science didn't support it. The marketing didn't care.

climax.text: What DOES help: actually learning music. Playing an instrument improves executive function, memory, and academic.

punchline.text: Listening to Mozart doesn't make you smarter. Playing music does.
